Okay, so, this is a bit tricky. Dead by Daylight can be a good game, a great game even... but it's rare and I can't recommend it. Most of the time it downright sucks, mostly because of bugs and bad--what am I saying, awful MMR.
For the first 200 hours of play, do not expect to have any sort of fun, as survivor or as killer. You'll start having some kind of fun when, well, the very much broken MMR will luckily pit you against someone your level... or slightly lower. Then, you can experience the mechanics without getting stomped senseless. But remember, this is awfully rare! Most of the time, you'll have just a bad to 'meh' experience.

So this is a game I play regularly but can't recommend, I've quit this game for months at a time in the past since I can't get along as solo survivor (I'm trash tier survivor) and as killer I face far higher ranks than mine/SWF on comms more often than not, the latter you get a lot of toxicity from which doesn't help either.

The biggest issue this game has is balance, for all the arguing on either side of the killer/survivor divide, the game IS survivor favoured, it has to be. They want to keep making money and if 4 out of the 5 players in any match can have fun and keep playing/buying DLCs, they won't care about the 5th player, even if without that player the game itself can't function.

I advise you to watch youtubers or streamers to get a better idea before taking the plunge, their game play is what you can hope to emulate after a few hundred hours or so.

I played 243 hours to this game and I'm not sure yet if I would recommend this game to someone. Yeah, I enjoy playing with friends to DBD. Yeah, I hate the community. Yeah, it has some bugs that I'm surprise they exist now that the game has 4 years. I would recommend you the game if you like the mecanics and have friends to play with. Don't expect too much from it, that's all I can say.

For the first 20 hours this game will make you scared as hell, after that you will actually start to enjoy the gameplay, which is very particular in my opinion. In this game you can play as killer or survivor, where a match is composed of 1 killer vs 4 survivors. Survivors has to repair generators to escape, while the killer will try to kill them. I really like the whole perk system and "bloodweb" character progression. Keep in mind that this game has quite long matchmaking time and also it will require a good amount of skill in order to play it at its full potential. I suggest you to get this game (best on sale) especially if you plan to play this with friends, give it a shot.

At this point I have 538 hours in this game.
My biggest issue is the unlocking system. There is no clear shop nor advancement so you will either get super lucky or have to spend money to be able to use the actually good/meta perks. 
Even after you bought the character to whom that certain perk belongs you have to grind out that character to be able to teach the perk to everyone else and after that you can grind it out on everyone you want to use it on.
Imagine if you had to buy in League of Legends the summoner spells, but to be able to use them you have to grind them out on every single champion.
